00017 #ifndef SkSystemEventTypes_DEFINED
00018 #define SkSystemEventTypes_DEFINED
00019 
00020 /*
00021     The goal of these strings is two-fold:
00022     1) make funny strings (containing at least one char < 32) to avoid colliding with "user" strings
00023     2) keep them <= 4 bytes, so we can avoid an allocation in SkEvent::setType()
00024 */
00025 #define SK_EventType_Delay      "\xd" "lay"
00026 #define SK_EventType_Inval      "nv" "\xa" "l"
00027 #define SK_EventType_Key        "key" "\x1" 
00028 #define SK_EventType_OnEnd "on" "\xe" "n"
00029 #define SK_EventType_Unichar    "\xc" "har"
00030 #define SK_EventType_KeyUp      "key" "\xf"
00031 
00032 #endif
